responses: I've worked as a software developer at Cascadia Carbon, Project Human City, and Excel Lassonde. At Cascadia Carbon, I revamped a React web app to Next.js, deployed it to Firebase, and enhanced user experience resulting in increased engagement. At Project Human City, I collaborated with teams to improve product responsiveness and accessibility, developed new React components, and refactored a secure Node.js backend. At Excel Lassonde, I optimized performance, revamped UI designs, integrated authentication systems, and transformed backend systems.

My professional experience includes roles at Cascadia Carbon, Project Human City, and Excel Lassonde, where I've contributed to various projects aimed at enhancing user experience, improving product responsiveness, and optimizing performance.

responses: I've worked on several projects including CrimeVue and Fact Checking Platform. CrimeVue is a web application for real-time crime analysis developed using Python, JavaScript, Next.js, Node.js, Express.js, and MongoDB. Fact Checking Platform is a user-centric fact-checking website built in React that reduces misinformation consumption by providing accurate information.

Some of my projects include CrimeVue, a real-time crime analysis web app, and Fact Checking Platform, a user-centric fact-checking website. These projects demonstrate my skills in full-stack development, database management, and user interface design.
